abstract: Twitter’s first developer conference, held this week in San Francisco, served as a coming-out party for the four-year-old service. Twitter the start-up is becoming Twitter the big company, with more polish, controversy, competition and revenue.
snippet: Twitter’s first developer conference, held this week in San Francisco, served as a coming-out party for the four-year-old service. Twitter the start-up is becoming Twitter the big company, with more polish, controversy, competition and revenue.
lead_paragraph: Twitter‘s first developer conference, held this week in San Francisco, served as a coming-out party for the four-year-old service. Twitter the start-up is becoming Twitter the big company, with more polish, controversy, competition and revenue.

headline.main: Twitter Loses Its Scrappy Start-Up Status

abstract: Shares on Wall Street fell sharply after Google’s profit failed to impress traders and after the government accused Goldman Sachs of defrauding investors.
snippet: Shares on Wall Street fell sharply after Google’s profit failed to impress traders and after the government accused Goldman Sachs of defrauding investors.
lead_paragraph: Wall Street seemed headed for another strong weekly finish on Friday — and then the news hit.

headline.main: Wall Street’s Win Streak Ends at 6
headline.print_headline: Winning Streak For Wall Street Ends at 6 Days

abstract: Google has made a few changes that can make searches quicker, and yield correct responses even to the spelling-challenged.
snippet: Google has made a few changes that can make searches quicker, and yield correct responses even to the spelling-challenged.
lead_paragraph: Finishing your sentences, correcting misspellings — Google is either coming to resemble a spookily sentient computer intelligence, or an annoying spouse.

abstract: This week the Bits blog readers debated NASA and G.M. sending robots into space, Twitter’s new business models and features and the role of Google in the Apple and Adobe faceoff.
snippet: This week the Bits blog readers debated NASA and G.M. sending robots into space, Twitter’s new business models and features and the role of Google in the Apple and Adobe faceoff.
lead_paragraph: This weeks rumblings of a Google slate PC stirred up the blogosphere and the Bits comments. The post A Google Tablet Could Be Good News for Adobe asked if Google could be a white knight for Adobe and its struggling Flash platform and generated a healthy debate about the future of both companies’ battle against Apple’s iPhone operating system. An anonymous commenter summed up Google’s goals:

headline.main: Comments of the Week: Robots, Nerds and Adobe Flash
